alert.note: Alert for Tulare (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 25 at 1:31PM PST until February 25 at 11:00PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following county, Tulare. * WHEN...Until 330 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 129 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain in the area. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused roadway flooding in Highway 99 which is closed near Pixley. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Visalia, Tulare, Porterville, Lindsay, Farmersville, Exeter, Woodlake, Terra Bella, Strathmore, Woodville, Poplar-Cotton Center, Ivanhoe, Ducor, Tipton, Lindcove, Lemon Cove and Pixley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
